MCQ: Who coined the term machine learning in 1959?
Choices: a: Donald Hebb | b: Tom M. Mitchell | c: Arthur Samuel | d: Raytheon Company

MCQ: What was the earliest machine learning model introduced by Arthur Samuel in the 1950s?
Choices: a: Program for calculating winning chance in checkers | b: Learning machine with punched tape memory | c: Artificial neural network | d: Computer vision of moles

MCQ: Who proposed the early mathematical models of neural networks to mirror human thought processes?
Choices: a: Donald Hebb | b: Walter Pitts | c: Warren McCulloch | d: Tom M. Mitchell

MCQ: What is the main objective of modern-day machine learning?
Choices: a: To develop new computer games | b: To classify data based on developed models | c: To study human cognitive processes | d: To predict stock market trends

MCQ: According to Tom M. Mitchell, when is a computer program said to learn from experience?
Choices: a: When it can play chess | b: When its performance improves with experience | c: When it can recognize speech patterns | d: When it can analyze sonar signals
